Class GunDisplay

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.Interfaces.GunDisplay
public class GunDisplay extends Object
Class responsible for displaying the current gun in use on the screen. It provides functionality to display and update the gun's name.

  • Constructor Details

    • GunDisplay

      public GunDisplay()
      Constructor to initialize the GunDisplay with the default gun. It creates a VBox container and a Text object for the default gun ("PISTOL").

  • Method Details

    • updateGunDisplay

      public void updateGunDisplay(String gunName)
      Updates the displayed gun name.
      Parameters:
      gunName - The name of the new gun to be displayed.

    • createGunText

      private javafx.scene.text.Text createGunText(String gunName)
      Creates a Text object for displaying the gun name with the specified styling.
      Parameters:
      gunName - The name of the gun to display.
      Returns:
      The styled Text object.

    • getGunBox

      public javafx.scene.layout.VBox getGunBox()
      Gets the VBox containing the gun display.
      Returns:
      The VBox containing the gun display elements.

    • getGunText

      public javafx.scene.text.Text getGunText()
      Gets the Text object that displays the current gun.
      Returns:
      The Text object displaying the current gun.
